intro: Viola vaginata f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered violet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Violaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and small, lanceolate leaves. The flowers bloom in early spring and are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies.
